revised_title: On the Variations of the Magnetical Compass and the True Longitude of the Magellan Straits
tldr: The author, E. Halley, discusses the variations of the magnetic compass and their impact on navigation charts. He addresses criticisms of his work and defends his methods for determining the true longitude of the Magellan Straits. The author also highlights the importance of collecting more observations in the Pacific Ocean to improve the accuracy of future discoveries.
